byline.contributor: Michael Forsythe contributed reporting from Hong Kong. Vanessa Piao and Kiki Zhao contributed research.

abstract: Chinese state media reports that at least 39 firefighters died in explosion at warehouse in Tianjin that left total of 114 dead, and 70 people unaccounted for, many of them private firefighters; is deadliest disaster involving Chinese firefighters since 1949.
lead_paragraph: At least 39 firefighters were among the 114 people killed by the cataclysmic explosions in the Chinese port city of Tianjin.

headline.main: In Tianjin Blasts, a Heavy Toll for Unsuspecting Firefighters
headline.print_headline: China Blasts Take Big Toll on Fire Crews

snippet: At least 39 firefighters were among the 114 people killed by the cataclysmic explosions in the Chinese port city of Tianjin.

keywords.value: Rui Hai International Logistics Co Ltd
